column1: West Hollywood is a city in Los Angeles County
column2: California
column3: United States. Incorporated in 1984
column4: it is home to the Sunset Strip. As of the 2010 U.S. Census
column5: its population was 34
column6: 399. It is considered one of the most prominent gay villages in the United States.

column1: Most historical writings about West Hollywood begin in the late-18th century with European colonization when the Portuguese explorer João Rodrigues Cabrilho arrived offshore and claimed the already inhabited region for Spain. Around 5
column2: 000 of the indigenous inhabitants from the Tongva Indian tribe canoed out to greet the ship. The Tongva tribe was a nation of hunter-gatherers known for their reverence of dance and courage. By 1771
column3: these native people had been severely ravaged by the diseases brought in by the Europeans from across wide oceans. The Spanish mission system changed the tribal name to "Gabrielinos"
column4: in reference to the Mission de San Gabriel. Early in 1770 Gaspar de Portola's Mexican expeditionary force stopped just south of the Santa Monica Mountains near what would become West Hollywood to draw pitch (brea in Spanish) from tar pits to waterproof their belongings and to say Mass. The Gabrielinos are believed to have burned the pitch for fuel.By 1780
column5: what became the "Sunset Strip" was the major connecting road for El Pueblo de Los Angeles
column6: and all ranches westward to the Pacific Ocean. This land passed through the hands of various owners during the next one hundred years
column7: and it was called names such as "La Brea" and "Plummer" that are listed in historical records.  Most of this area was part of the Rancho La Brea
column8: and eventually it came to be owned by the Henry Hancock family.During the final decade years of the nineteenth century
column9: the first large land development in what would later become West Hollywood—the town of "Sherman"—was established by Moses Sherman and his partners of the Los Angeles Pacific Railroad
column10: an interurban railroad line which later became part of the Pacific Electric Railway system. Sherman became the location of the railroad's main shops
column12: and "car barns". Many working-class employees of the railroad settled in this town. It was during this time that the city began to earn its reputation as a loosely regulated
column13: liquor-friendly (during Prohibition) place for eccentric people wary of government interference. Despite several annexation attempts
column14: the town elected not to become part of the City of Los Angeles. In a controversial decision
column16: "...a moniker pioneered earlier in the decade by the West Hollywood Realty Board" as its informal name
column17: though it remained under the governance of Los Angeles County.For many decades
column18: the area that is now the city of West Hollywood was an unincorporated area in the midst of Los Angeles. Because gambling was illegal in the city of Los Angeles
column19: but still legal in Los Angeles County
column20: the 1920s saw the proliferation of many casinos
column23: along Sunset Boulevard (which starts near downtown Los Angeles and runs westward). These businesses were immune from the sometimes heavy-handed law-enforcement of the L.A. Police Department.

column1: Some people connected with movie-making were attracted to this less-restricted area of the County
column2: and a number of architecturally distinctive apartment buildings and hotels were built. Many interior designers
column3: decorators and "to the trade" furnishing showrooms located in West Hollywood date back to the middle of the century.

column2: the area and its extravagant nightclubs fell out of favor. However
column3: the Sunset Strip and its restaurants
column4: saloons
column5: and nightclubs continued to be an attraction for out-of-town tourists. During the late 1960s
column6: the Sunset Strip was transformed again during the hippie movement which brought a thriving music publishing industry coupled with the "hippie" culture. Some young people from all over the country flocked to West Hollywood.

column1: The most recent migration to West Hollywood came about after the dissolution of the Soviet Union
column2: when thousands of Russian Jews immigrated to the city. A majority of the 5
column4: 000 Russian Jews settled in two major immigration waves
column5: 1978–79 and 1988–92. Other than New York
column6: West Hollywood's Russian-speaking community is the most concentrated single Russian-speaking region in United States.The Gauntlet was a body piercing business founded by Jim Ward in West Hollywood that is considered the first business of its type in the United States and was the beginning of the body piercing industry. The Gauntlet began in November 1975
column7: with its original location in Ward's West Hollywood home
column8: but on the evening of Friday
column10: 1978 it celebrated the grand opening of its first commercial location at 8720 Santa Monica Boulevard (also in West Hollywood).

column2: residents in West Hollywood organized to maintain rent control. When Los Angeles County began planning to discontinue rent controls
column3: West Hollywood was a densely populated area of renters
column4: many of whom would not be able to afford to keep up with the generally rapid raises in rent in the Los Angeles area. A tight coalition of seniors
column5: Jews
column6: gays and renters were greatly assisted by the Coalition for Economic Survival (CES)and they swiftly voted to incorporate as the "City of West Hollywood".  West Hollywood then immediately adopted one of the strongest rent control laws in the nation.The city of West Hollywood gave the keys to the city to Stormy Daniels on "Stormy Daniels Day"
column7: May 23

column1: West Hollywood is bounded by the city of Beverly Hills on the west
column2: and by neighborhoods of the city of Los Angeles: Hollywood Hills on the north
column3: Hollywood on the east
column4: the Fairfax District on the southeast
column5: and Beverly Grove on the southwest. The city's irregular boundary is featured in its logo; it was largely formed from the unincorporated Los Angeles County area which had not become part of the surrounding cities.West Hollywood benefits from a very dense
column6: compact urban form with small lots
column7: mixed land use
column8: and a walkable street grid. According to Walkscore
column9: a website that ranks cities based on walkability
column10: West Hollywood is the most walkable city in California with a Walkscore of 89. Commercial corridors include the nightlife and dining focused on the Sunset Strip
column12: and the Avenues of Art and Design along Robertson
column14: and Beverly Boulevard.Residential neighborhoods in West Hollywood include the Norma Triangle
column19: all of which are only a few blocks long or wide. Major intersecting streets typically provide amenities within walking distance of adjacent neighborhoods.

column1: West Hollywood has a Subtropical-semi-arid climate with year-round warm weather. The record high temperature of 111 °F was recorded September 26
column3: while the record low of 24 °F was recorded on January 4
column4: 1949. Snow is rare in West Hollywood
column5: with the last accumulation occurring in 1949. Rainfall is sparse (only 13 inches annually)
column6: and falls mainly during the winter months.

column1: The West Hollywood Halloween Carnival is an event that takes place annually on October 31.  The largest Halloween street party in the United States (spanning over 1 mile (1.6 km) of Santa Monica Boulevard from La Cienega Boulevard on the East to Doheny and the Beverly Hills border on the West)
column2: the 2007 Carnival was reported to have more than 350
column3: 000 people in attendance
column4: with some traveling from other countries specifically for the event.

column1: Christopher Street West is an LGBT pride parade and festival that was first held in June 1970 in Hollywood to commemorate the first anniversary of the Stonewall Riots in New York.  After incorporation
column2: the event moved to West Hollywood and is typically held the second weekend in June.

column1: One City One Pride is an LGBT Arts Festival held during the month of June in West Hollywood.The West Hollywood Book Fair has been held in the fall since 2001. Past participants have included Andrew McCarthy
column2: Deepak Chopra
column3: and Rocco DiSpirito.The Oscars is a major event in the city with a majority of the large Academy Award party venues being located in the city. Many streets are closed and traffic swells on this day each year.

column1: Frontrunners LGBT Pride Run is a 5 km/10 km run/walk held on the Sunday morning of LGBT Pride.
The City of West Hollywood sponsors an animal walk and pet appreciation days throughout the year
column2: which have in the past featured pet psychics and dog activities. During Halloween the week prior to October 31
column3: animals can participate in a costume contest in West Hollywood Park. West Hollywood is in close proximity to Runyon Canyon Park's hiking trail and dog park in Hollywood.

column1: The Elton John AIDS Foundation Academy Awards Party has traditionally been held at the Pacific Design Center. It is a multimillion-dollar fundraiser for the foundation.West Hollywood has many ongoing programs to celebrate the vibrant arts and unique culture of the city. The literary community is acknowledged with the year-round author series WeHo Reads
column2: featuring new and noteworthy authors at the West Hollywood Library with a full day literary event each fall. An annual PowPow is presented by AIDS Project Los Angeles Red Circle Project and the City of West Hollywood. This event
column3: held at Plummer Park promotes HIV awareness and prevention among the Native communities and features dance
column4: music
column5: food
column6: and educational resources.West Hollywood inaugurated the first City Poet

column1: With a population of over one third identifying as lesbian
column2: gay
column3: bisexual or transgender
column4: West Hollywood has become a leader of communities in showcasing how to protect and advocate for equal rights for the LGBT community. With its spirit and vibrant urban setting
column5: West Hollywood has become one of the world’s top gay vacation spots for gay and lesbian travelers and is at the center of gay California nightlife
column6: including spas
column7: shopping and dining. A small but energetic city
column8: it contains the greatest concentration of gay-popular hotels
column11: and bars in greater Los Angeles. Circus of Books was a bookstore and gay pornography shop that was notable as a gay cruising spot of the late 20th Century. The city also hosts some of the area’s largest LGBT events such as the Los Angeles Gay Pride
column13: and West Hollywood Halloween Costume Carnival. Commonly referred to as ‘Gay WeHo’
column14: the city's Gay West Hollywood Twitter page quotes “The World's Most Incredible & Magical Gay City with 25 Gay Bars
column16: and 69 Gay Friendly Restaurants accessible on foot
column17: California.In keeping with the city's gay community
column18: many resources unknown or uncommon anywhere else have been provided; there is a page on the city’s official visitors guide dedicated to ‘Host Your Gay Wedding With Us’ as the city has long been the originator and groundbreaking in the gay marriage movement. Also
column19: the city hosts expansive historical records of the LGBT community. The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives is dedicated exclusively to preserving lesbian history and remains the only archive in the western United States to do so. The West Hollywood Library also hosts an extensive collection of LGBT literature and history and includes the Ron Shipton HIV Information Center. According to an LA Times article
column20: an exhibit at the ONE Archives Gallery and Museum is the first museum in Southern California exclusively dedicated to gay history. In 2018 America's first city-wide Bi Pride event was held in West Hollywood.

column1: The city government is headed by a five-member city council
column2: including a mayor and a mayor pro tem who serve one-year terms. The positions of mayor and mayor pro tem are largely-ceremonial positions which rotate between the council members
column3: and both positions are largely not re-elected in concurrent terms
column4: although council members serve multiple non-concurrent terms in both offices. Currently
column5: the five Council Members are Lindsey P. Horvath
column6: John Heilman
column7: John D’Amico
column8: John J. Duran amd Lauren Meister.

column1: West Hollywood was the first city in the country to have a city council with a majority of gay members. The current Mayor is John Duran after getting elected on March 6
column2: 2001.  Council member and law professor John Heilman is the city's  longest-serving council member (having served almost continuously since November 1984).On February 19
column4: West Hollywood became the second city in the United States (after Boulder
column5: Colorado) to change the term pet "owner" to pet "guardian" in their municipal codes.With West Hollywood being one of the most prominent gay-friendly cities in the United States
column6: Proposition 8 had a higher rate of rejection than it did in any other city in Los Angeles county: 86% of the city voted against the amendment
column7: which restricted marriage to heterosexual couples.

column1: West Hollywood is part of the Los Angeles Unified School District. The area is within Board District 4.Elementary schools that serve sections of West Hollywood include:
Gardner Street Elementary School K-6(Some areas jointly zoned to Rosewood and West Hollywood)

Most of West Hollywood is zoned to Bancroft Middle School. Some portions in the south are zoned to John Burroughs Middle School.  Students living in the Los Angeles area known as Beverly Hills Post Office
column2: usually attend West Hollywood Elementary but then go to Emerson Middle School.

column1: West Hollywood College Preparatory School (WHCP) K-12
Pacific Hills SchoolAll of West Hollywood is zoned to Fairfax High School; some areas are jointly zoned to Fairfax High School and Hollywood High School.
The Center for Early Education and Pacific Hills School are private schools in West Hollywood.

column2: public transport and parking are critical issues in the city due to its location between access to areas such as Greater Hollywood to the east and the San Fernando Valley to the north and the area of the Los Angeles West Side
column3: with the Hollywood Hills creating a natural impediment to the north. Santa Monica Boulevard and Sunset Boulevard are critical east-west arteries in the metropolitan area
column4: and Laurel Canyon Boulevard is a popular shortcut through the hills. Nearly 600 employees and 260 buses in the District 7 fleet of the LACMTA are based in a large facility on prime real estate near San Vicente Boulevard and Santa Monica Boulevard. The Crenshaw/LAX Line extension to the Hollywood/Highland station is likely to pass through
column5: or along
column6: the edge of West Hollywood.

column2: the City of West Hollywood launched a free Friday and Saturday night shuttle
column3: the PickUp
column4: connecting the eastern and western parts of the city. The goal of The PickUp is to provide an alternative to the automobile and bring an energetic and playful transit option to one of West Hollywood’s busiest nighttime districts. The Public Relations Society of America Los Angeles Chapter (PRSA-LA) has recognized the City of West Hollywood with a PRism Award of Excellence in the category of New Product/Service Launch for the city’s kick-off campaign for the PickUp.

column2: the City of West Hollywood launched a new free shuttle service called The Sunset Trip. This service focuses on shuttling riders on Sunset Boulevard
column3: but also crosses the PickUp shuttle route to allow transfers.

column1: The Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department operates the West Hollywood Station.The Los Angeles County Department of Health Services operates the Hollywood-Wilshire Health Center in Hollywood
column2: serving West Hollywood.Fire protection in West Hollywood is provided by the Los Angeles County Fire Department. LACoFD operates Station 7
column3: the battalion headquarters
column4: and Station 8
column5: both in West Hollywood
column6: as a part of Battalion 1.Emergency Medical Services are provided by LACoFD and McCormick Ambulance.

column2: with a gay male population of about 39%
column3: has been disproportionately affected by the HIV/AIDS epidemic which has ravaged its gay male population since the early 1980s. The city funds or subsidizes an array of services for those living with HIV or AIDS. The AIDS Healthcare Foundation parks a Mobile HIV/STD testing van outside of the city's busiest nightclubs on Friday and Saturday nights
column4: and again on Sunday afternoons.  This outreach attempts to intervene with those young people most at-risk for HIV infection. Project Angel Food receives city funding to deliver hundreds of fresh lunches and dinners daily which are prepared under the supervision of a registered dietitian who tailors the meals to meet individual client's nutritional needs. AIDS Project Los Angeles (APLA) is a national leader for AIDS policy and advocacy issues and provides assistance to clients navigating the maze of available public benefits.  APLA also provides free dental
column5: psychotherapy and pharmaceutical services. Aid for AIDS provides direct financial support by assisting clients with rent
column6: utility and pharmacy expenses.  The city also subsidizes agencies that help clients train for a return to the workforce. The city permits all residents living with HIV/AIDS to have up to two pets in his or her home regardless of a landlord's specifications in the property's lease.

column1: West Hollywood subsidizes programs for its growing population of children through a partnership with the USDA and local schools.  "Healthy Start West Hollywood" is a program of the city's Social Services division that introduces pre-Kindergarten through High School age kids to the benefits of good nutrition through such activities as collective vegetable gardens and yoga.
The special needs of senior citizens are addressed through a variety of programs.  West Hollywood either funds or subsidizes agencies that offer adult day care
column2: a roommate matching service
column3: and nutritious meals.  The West Hollywood Senior Center provides recreational programs
column4: excursions
column5: and socializing as well as counseling and case management.

column1: West Hollywood also seeks to address the health needs of residents who do not have adequate insurance by subsidizing the LA Free Clinic and The Los Angeles Gay and Lesbian Center.  Residents can access free medical
column2: dental
column3: legal and mental health services between these two sites.

column1: The West Hollywood's Public Safety Division publishes guides on sexual assault prevention
column2: nightclub safety
column3: and how to access rape services.

column11: and the interior incorporates design work by Fairey and David Wiseman.

column1: The issue of Paparazzi chasing celebrities is raised regularly and the city participates in meetings with other nearby municipalities such as Beverly Hills and Los Angeles to discuss the problem and possible actions to better control the activity. column2: West Hollywood was the first city to create a same-gender domestic partnership registration for its residents
column3: as well as to offer same-gender domestic partner benefits for city employees. West Hollywood's comprehensive Domestic Partnership Ordinance allows those couples that are prohibited from marrying (same-sex) and those who can marry but choose not to (heterosexual)
column4: to register their union with the city. These unions are treated on an equal basis with legal marriages with respect to city-level benefits and services. In California as a whole
column5: same-sex couples may enter domestic partnerships which offer them all of the state rights of marriage.West Hollywood has inclusionary zoning laws governing development. The city established the Affordable Housing Trust Fund in 1986 requiring developers to either provide affordable housing in new projects or pay a fee in-lieu to the city which it directs towards other affordable housing projects.

column1: In 1993 the West Hollywood City Council voted for West Hollywood to become the first official pro-choice city in America.In 2006
column2: the City Council passed a medicinal marijuana resolution
column3: by a vote of 4–0
column4: making it the first city in Southern California to adopt a lowest law enforcement priority law for cannabis offenses. The resolution stated "it is not the policy of the City or its law enforcement agency to target possession of small amounts of cannabis and the consumption of non-medical cannabis in private by adults".West Hollywood adopted one of the nation's first mandatory green building ordinances on October 1
column5: 2007.The city designed a law that pets are to be called "companions" and their owners "guardians" and was the first city in the country to outlaw the de-clawing of cats. In 2011
column6: West Hollywood became the first city in the United States to ban the sale of clothing with real animal fur; the ban took effect on September 21
column8: the ordinance was upheld by the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California
column9: after a local business had challenged the prohibition as unconstitutional.Legislation prohibiting discrimination in the workplace on the basis of sexual orientation is widely recognized as the toughest in the nation. The city is one of 92 jurisdictions in the country where it is illegal to discriminate on the basis of gender identity or expression.City legislation bans the sale of handguns
column11: and restricts the city from doing business directly or indirectly (via vendors) with any country known to violate human rights. The city has banned the use of gas-powered leaf blowers.
